definition: to parade sb through the streets/to march or parade in the streets
to swim/variant of 遊|游[you2]
to walk/to tour/to roam/to travel
surname You
street/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to parade (a prisoner) through the streets

sentences.english: Whenever Gaddafi visited Italy, he was paraded as a guest of honor.
sentences.chinese: 每当卡扎菲访问意大利，他被游街当作荣誉嘉宾。

sentences.english: Local authorities require the family of the condemned, including young children, to stand in the front row of spectators.
sentences.chinese: 地方政府要求其家庭连坐，包括儿童都要游街。

sentences.english: The criminals were paraded in chains through the crowded streets.
sentences.chinese: 罪犯带着镣铐被押着列队游街示众。

sentences.english: Now, go out about the town covered in the horsehair sheet holding the horse’s head up on a pike.
sentences.chinese: 现在用长矛举着披着马毛床单的马头去游街吧。

sentences.english: The captured criminals were paraded through the streets.
sentences.chinese: 抓获的罪犯被游街示众。

sentences.english: The captured criminals were paraded through the main streets.
sentences.chinese: 被抓获的犯人列队游街示众。

sentences.english: My wife pulls into the street parade, receive flattery or compliment, she what sin?
sentences.chinese: 把我老婆拉到街上游街，戴高帽子，她有什么罪？

sentences.english: Indeed, why not the patrons and the pimps?
sentences.chinese: 说真的，为什么老鸨和皮条客没有游街呢？

sentences.english: Sometimes you even see him parading down Main Street on stilts.
sentences.chinese: 有时候，你甚至可以看到他游街下来高跷大街。

sentences.english: When the boys returned home, they were paraded through the streets.
sentences.chinese: 球队回到家乡后游街庆祝。

definition: to parade (a prisoner) through the streets
to publicly expose
march/parade/demonstration
to parade oneself ostentatiously about town (idiom)
execution ground/gallows/scaffold
palanquin with eight carriers/(fig.) lavish treatment
execution ground
to beat the gong to clear the way/(fig.) to pave the way for sth
to carry out a (death) sentence/execution
in the middle of the street/facing the street
to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
to behead sb and display the head in public
to drape sb in red silk as a sign of honor
bridal sedan chair
to attend a funeral/to take part in a funeral procession
to bind a person's upper body, with arms tied behind the back and rope looped around the neck/to truss up
